intro: Cephalaria graeca, commonly known as Greek cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish or purple in color. Cephalaria graeca is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
